Reviews.Title: “No frills sleep”
Reviews.Author: Miramaks
Reviews.Content: Really small room with squeaking panel floor, broken glass accross the wardrobe doors. Yet clean and in order - same as the bathroom. Large set of bath utensils. Windows can't be left in small opening for ventillation, hence problems with fresh air int he room. Free wi-fi, but quite slow and with few black spots. Small selection of food for the breakfast. Positive: - good communication due to vicinity of Sants station - easy walk to Montjuic fairgrounds, which is a big asset during Mobile World Congress - nice and simple setup of public areas, especially the restaurants - helpful and friendly staff Bottom line - good for overnight sleep for a busy visit to Barcelona. For a romantic weekend I would select something closer to La Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: fussweh
Reviews.Content: A great location if arriving to the main rail station at sants. just 5 mins easy walk across from main entrance to avenida tarragona. easy access to underground, and all parts of the city. requested and obtained a quiet internal courtyard room. the room was adequate for 2 people, and fine for sole occupancy, with nice modern decor, and a comfortable bed. free wifi also in bedrooms. local bars and eating places within a few minutes walk. the hotel also had a nice breakfast room and lounge area, though i did not take the breakfast. all the staff on reception were really helpful, with local tips, dealing with my travel companions delayed arrival, and holding luggage for a late departure. the only negative was that i found that the bathroom a bit too small for a big guy, though all fittings were good quality and worked just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel away from the centre of the city”
Reviews.Author: majikthise
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a 5 minute walk from the Sants railway station, from where you can catch the metro into the city centre. The room was small and simple, but clean, and the bed was quite firm, which I prefer. The rooms and corridors have wooden floors, and as some other reviewers have commented, are not terribly well soundproofed, and noise from the corridor could be a problem. The aircon is also quite noisy on the high setting, and I recommend setting it to low if you want to sleep well (or just bring ear plugs). I had a room at the back of the hotel, so I did not experience any problem with noise from outside. The wifi is free, and worked perfectly fine in my room on the first floor. At 65 euros per night (not including breakfast), I think this is good value for Barcelona. Despite the railway station nearby, there are not many eating options close to the hotel, so you should eat in the centre before coming back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “near train station”
Reviews.Author: nubuk
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this place for a long weekend with some friends and enjoyed it. we didn't have breakfast there but rather outside at one of the bistros. it is well located near the train&metro station - from where you can get anywhere in barcelona within a reasonable time (what this means is up to you). the rooms were nice, not huge but ok if you do not plan to stay in there for something other than sleeping. however, you get to hear it if someone walks the hallway or talks loud in the neighbouring rooms. rem: the bathtubs are tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Average, not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Marducita
Reviews.Content: The hotel and room were fine in general, I chose it because it was near Sants station. Very good breakfast with fresh coffee, fruits, and all kinds of stuff, in a big room. Breakfast was the best part at this hotel. The room was ok and had minibar, but didn't look like 4 stars and it was small and with an ugly view although that was not a problem for me since I requested not to be placed at the front to prevent noises from the street. The staff wasn't very helpful, we had a problem with the heating (too hot, unable to switch off) and they couldn't fix it, just offered us to change rooms, which we didn't want because we had already unpacked. The safe in the room never worked, we told reception but they couldn't fix it either. I also didn't like the '90s decoration and the lack of bidet in the bathroom (in Spain most hotels have it). Also, a lady at the reception who was a local, didn't know about the existence of a mayor church of the city and told me I was wrong about it (I was right), which was misleading for us. They never treated us badly, but weren't very helpful or nice either. I would rate this hotel 3 stars at the most. Anyway I would come back because it was ok in general terms.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Dsalout
Reviews.Content: We stayed in over 5 hotels in Europe and this was by far the worst. Paper thin walls, horrible bed, and bad customer service. Internet was " not working" during our entire stay there. Got 2 hours of sleep, not at all a vacation experience.1 star Motel not a 4 star hotel:(

Reviews.Title: “Not 4* star standard!”
Reviews.Author: kirstenrd
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been given a 4* rating but I would give it a 2*. It was very dated, the rooms were very basic and not what you expect from a 4*rating. The hotel is right next door to the Barcelona prison which they do not tell you about when advertising! The hotel was far away from the main attractions and not walking distance. I wouldn't recommend this hotel unless you are looking for a basic cheap 2* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A bit far out but great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Naomi_Gabrielle
Reviews.Content: Wanting a cheep getaway on a low budget and we managed it and had an absolutely excellent time. The hotel was great, the one and only mini complaint was that in the room we were put it originally, the air conditioning didn't work, when we told the staff of this fact, they were excellent and moved us immediately to a room with fully working air-con with no fuss. The room was small, but clean and the bathroom was newly refurbished and very nice and luxurious. The hotel was quite far out from the main sites, and after making the walk once, we never did it again, Sants station was a 5mins walk from the hotel and using that to get into the "tourist zone" was by far the preferred way of getting there. The hotel did provide breakfast (either a "full buffet" or "simple breakfast") at a cost, but for a reduced amount you could have a very simular simple breakfast (fruit juice, coffee and pastry) at Pans and Co next to the station which was one of the yummiest breakfasts we had ever had, totally recommend it! To sum up, this hotel was lovely, and the staff were great, if you want a higher class of hotel without the price tag to match this is definately a goer, if you want to be "in on the action" from dawn until dusk then this isn't the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona-pickpockets”
Reviews.Author: Bradders2175
Reviews.Content: This was an overnight stay unfortunately, but we didn't have time to stay longer. However, we will return. We stayed at the Confort Barcelona, a new 4* hotel. There are some rundown buildings locally, but I think the owners are taking the long view that it will get nicer. There are good, busy restaurants around the corner. The bed was big and comfortable. The design is modern. You won't want to sit for long in the chairs in the room. Very uncomfortable! Underground parking €20, but take it as you won't find anywhere on the street! Breakfast €15 as I paid the staff in cash and didn't charge it to my room. OK, but mediocre. The nearest tube/metro station is not too far away, but the area at night did make me feel a bit uneasy. €1.35 for a single journey on the metro is good value for money. Keep some loose change in your pocket as none of the machines that we saw would give change for anything larger than €10 notes. If you plan to do a lot of sightseeing in one day, the multitrip ticket for 10 journeys works out about half price. We were approached by beggars when trying to buy tickets. There is lots to see on the Las Ramblas. Lots of street acts, dancing, juggling, music etc. Lots of restaurants and bars. On the way back to our hotel on the metro, we were the victims of a group of pickpockets. I had already read about them and being an ex-Police Officer, thought that I might be more aware. I wasn't! A group of three males blocked us getting onto the train, my wife was slightly behind and was pushed out of the way by two others. I heard her shout 'Get your hand out!' I thought that she was being assaulted, I turned around to find a male immediately behind me, My wife said 'He had his hand in your pocket' I punched him twice hard (ex-copper mode coming to the fore!) I then stepped back to confront the others. I used to teach defensive skills and unfortunately in my mind I'm still 25 not 51 (that day!). My over confidence got me a punch in the face from one of the others, but I foolishly stood my ground and squared up to them. Fortunately for me, they all retreated, without my wallet. Bruised ego and face remained on the train. Needless to say, no help from anyone else! Our children were with friends at home, but I would still have reacted the same had they been there. It was a stupid, but natural reaction for me and I would still leap in to help anyone else in the same situation. It didn't spoil our enjoyment of Barcelona. It did however, remind us what we had left behind when we relocated to France three years ago. We will visit again, but get taxi's!

Reviews.Title: “WELL LOCATED”
Reviews.Author: vicramasinger
Reviews.Content: Firstly this hotel is in an excellent location very close to sants train and metro station , it can be reached from the airport in 25 minutes. We booked on a stay 2 nights , 3rd night free deal which was excellent value. If you are planning on using the wi fi service then think again it costs 9 euros for 1 hour !! or 15 euros for 24 hours. A much better option is to use the internet cafe around the corner on carrer de numancia . It is very cheap at 1 euro per hour and is also very close to pans & co which is an excellent place to buy breakfast . it has a decent selection of small sandwiches and croissants , cakes etc ,excellent coffee and fresh orange juice. a typical breakfast of small ham and cheese ciabbatta , glass of freshly squeezed orange , coffee and cake would cost around 5 euros, which is a big saving on the 12 euro hotel breakfast. Barcelona is an excellent city for a short break, all the obvious sights are well worth a visit, if you intend to visit monjuic , the olympic stadium is free to enter and the olympic museum is worth a look at 3 euros i wouldnt bother with the cable car ride to the castle at the top of the hill. its a very short ride , it doesnt offer great views and is scandalously expensive . better to take your time and walk up or if thats not an option simply take a taxi from the metro station. If you visit sagrada familia (gaudi's cathedral) make sure you take the lift ride to the top of the tower it costs 2.50 euros but its a must. One last thing as in all big cities you have to watch your pockets and bags all the time , my advice would be leave the wallet in the hotel and just take whatever cash you minght need for the day. The metro is rife with petty thieves and pick- pockets that prey on tourists, I was talking to an english guy on the metro who was robbed whilst we were talking, neither of us saw a thing . !! they seem to operate in groups and when the metro is at its busiest. hope this review helps

Reviews.Title: “Whatever you do at this hotel, don't have the breakfast. Poor value.”
Reviews.Author: CinzanoSuffolk
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, but there is a communication problem with the staff, particularly in the resturant. Lovely friendly lady, but spoke not a word of English. The breakfast is very poor value. Don't have it! Cold coffee, cake like scrambled egg, and everything runs out very quickly and is not replaced. Cost is excessive at 12 euros per person. Extremely helpful Swiss gentleman on reception though. His English was better than mine!

Reviews.Title: “Overall, good experience.”
Reviews.Author: AKLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Abbot hotel from 18th to 22nd February 2008. The hotel is well located, two blocks from one of the main railway station and Barcelona Sants underground station. The room was sufficiently big for us both. It seemed to be taken well care of, refurnished and clean. The towels were snow white clean, but they cried for a softener. We can only complain about the maid service: the sheet was washed, but not clean enough to hide a big stain in the place one cannot overlooks. The third day into our stay we came back to the room with the bath tub, which definitely was not cleaned. The breakfast was delicious but coffee was awful. On TV the only English channels are BBC World, CNN and Sky News.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: NicRich
Reviews.Content: I only stayed at the Abbot for 2 nights with my boyfriend and all i can say is everything was excellent. It was abit of a nuissance to get to as we flew to Gerona, therefore we had to get a coach to barcelona (1 hour, 19 euros return) and as it was late we got a cab to the Abbot (7 euros). No way would you get a cab from Gerona as it would cost 125 euros! The room was immaculate, a tad small but spacious for 2 people and very comfortable. Lots of wardrobe space, lovely bathroom, satellite tv but only had spanish channels on - your not going to be watching television if your in barcelona anyway! The staff were very friendly and gave us a map of the city and how best to get to places. they recommended the metro, as would i. It's so easy to use and so cheap. we actually used it to get back to the coach station. You only pay once and can go all over the city, on different trains. The staff recommended the most gorgeous restaurant, which is in Port Olympic. It's called Marina Moncho's. It was very romantic, service was excellent and they do the most amazing fish dishes. overall, our trip was excellent and would definatley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So-so, nothing special, nothing terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Abott is not old enough to be historically interesting and not new enough to be nice. Little TV, little bed, ok on cleanliness, slightly drab. Nothing about this hotel was especially good or bad, adequate. It is within walking distance of the subway but not in an area of interest to tourists. Your reason to stay here would be that you had business near by or wanted to be close to the train station (note that there are multiple train stations be sure what one you want) or you got a smoking deal. I don't say this place is terrible but as a tourist if I could do it again I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not Thrilled”
Reviews.Author: Angelfish'sMom
Reviews.Content: We needed to stay over one night in Barcelona after departing our cruise before we could get a flight home. While the room rates were reasonable, there were many areas that were disappointing. We asked for two rooms (2 parents and children), however, they needed to give us three rooms because they could not accommodate our 2 children in one room. We were on different floors which made our kids uncomfortable. Further, 2 of the rooms did not have clean sheets, or if they were changed, there was still body hair etc on the sheets. While the rooms otherwise appeared clean, the air conditioning in one room only worked moderately. It was very hot and this was a much needed commodity. This property was close to the underground subway and was easy to reach Las Ramblas. It cost us 28 Euros to the airport (two cabs as there were 4 of us). I guess I am not accustomed to paying more than than the agreed upon price which was 20 Euros. Overeall, we should have paid the extra money and stayed in a more expensive hotel. Remember, only CNN is in english.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at the Abbot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location 5 Mins from Sants Metro. Staff really friendly Breakfast A1.Nice decor and nice & clean. Would stay again.

HotelInfo.Name: Sercotel Abbot
HotelInfo.Address: Avenida de Roma 23, 08029 Barcelona, Spain
